grading_system.description: Mono County follows California Retail Food Code requirements but specific grading system not publicly detailed on county website

inspection_details.frequency: Based on risk assessment - routine inspections conducted at unannounced intervals
inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: Violations requiring correction or follow-up verification
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Inspection reports must be available upon request per California law but posting requirements not specified

facility_safety_authority.department_name: Local fire department/authority having jurisdiction - specific department not identified
facility_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: Commercial cooking appliances producing grease vapors require UL 300 compliant fire suppression systems with 6-month inspections per California Fire Code
facility_safety_authority.inspection_frequency: Every 6 months for commercial kitchen fire suppression systems

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Retail Food Code (CalCode) - portion of California Health and Safety Code
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County conducts inspections - Mono County Environmental Health Department responsible for routine inspections and permits
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: Not specified beyond state CalCode requirements

confidence_notes: Mono County's website provides basic program information but lacks specific details about grading system, inspection frequency schedules, risk categorization, and specific fire department authority. Most information inferred from general California practices.
verification_notes: Direct contact with Mono County Environmental Health Department (760) 924-1830 needed to verify: 1) Specific grading/scoring system used, 2) Inspection frequency by risk category, 3) Fire department jurisdiction for commercial kitchen systems, 4) Public posting requirements for inspection results, 5) Any local ordinances beyond CalCode
